books.title: The Economic Consequences of the Peace
books.author: John Maynard Keynes
books.summary: Keynes presents a first-hand account of the 1919 Paris Peace Conference and an analysis of the resulting Versailles treaty.

books.title: The Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: To prevent the passage of a controversial government bill, four vigilantes take the law into their own hands.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: The Man of Destiny
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Napoleon engages in a battle of wits to reclaim some stolen letters.

books.title: Exiles
books.author: James Joyce
books.summary: An unmarried couple in early twentieth-century Dublin struggle with the consequences of their respective infidelities.

books.title: The Return
books.author: Walter de la Mare
books.summary: After visiting a graveyard, a man finds his appearance has mysteriously changed.

books.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective returns to London after having faked his death some years before, and investigates a series of baffling mysteries.

books.title: The Case of Charles Dexter Ward
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: A young scholar delves into his family past and finds more than he bargained for.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: A Study in Scarlet
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The self-declared world’s first consulting detective unravels a mysterious case of murder and revenge.

books.title: The Conscience of a Conservative
books.author: Barry Goldwater
books.summary: A U.S. Senator and future presidential nominee outlines key principles of the 20th century American conservative movement.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Songs of the Cattle Trail and Cow Camp
books.author: John A. Lomax
books.summary: A collection of cowboy poetry collected by folklorist John A. Lomax.

books.title: Lady Windermere’s Fan
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A witty comedy that subverts the harsh social codes of Victorian England.

books.title: Stand by for Mars!
books.author: Carey Rockwell
books.summary: Young Tom Corbett finally realizes his dream of becoming a Space Cadet but soon he and his classmates find themselves fighting to stay alive in the harsh Martian desert.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Nella Larsen
books.summary: A collection of Nella Larsen’s short fiction by date of publication.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
